intro: Evolvulus aureobrunneus, commonly known as the golden-brown morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central America and the Caribbean. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and produces small, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant has hairy, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along forest edges. The flowers bloom in the morning and close by late afternoon, giving the plant its common name.
